metadata.title: CVE-2023-45862 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/usb/storage/ene_ub6250.c for the ENEUB6250 reader driver in the Linux kernel before 6.2.5. An object couldpotentially extend beyond the end of an allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-220-generic - 4.15.0-220.231
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-220-generic - 4.15.0-220.231
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-220-lowlatency - 4.15.0-220.231
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-220.231').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1').
